CatDescriptText: Mr. Charles Dow, Robinson Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 28, 1962, pg. 11 with question: "As a newspaper, reader, what type of stories have the greatest appeal to you; In other words, which stories do you read first?" Answer reads: "Front page and interracial incidents like what's happening in schools of the South and the sit-ins.  Those and editorials take my interest.  I'm not too interested in crime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Dow wearing hat with dark band, light colored coat, and plaid shirt, standing in front of brick buildings, possibly Terrace Village or Bedford Dwellings
